Counterpoise is a nonmagical weapon that becomes magical when one of its properties is used.

Advantageous Attack. Twice per long rest, when you make an attack with this weapon, you can choose to attack with advantage. Doing so also makes the weapon magical until the end of your next turn.

Tip the Scales. You can expend up to 3 charges to gain a bonus to attack and damage rolls with this weapon equal to the number of charges expended for 1 minute. Doing so also makes the weapon magical for the duration.

My Lady's Favor (Very Rare).name: My Lady's Favor (Very Rare)
My Lady's Favor (Very Rare).description:
Progression: My Lady's Favor progresses whenever the attuned creature's proficiency bonus increases.

Appropriately Dressed. While this magic weapon is on your person, you can use a bonus action to change the appearance of your clothing to something appropriate to the current situation. You can also remove bloodstains, damage, or other imperfections.

Appropriately Charming. You gain proficiency in the Persuasion skill. If you are already proficient, you gain expertise instead.

Appropriately Vicious. Once per long rest, you can use a bonus action to increase your Strength score by a number equal to your proficiency bonus (to a maximum of 22). This increase lasts for 10 minutes.

Appropriately Devastating. The weapon has 3 charges, and regains 1d3 expended charges when you finish a long rest. Each creature that eats the meal can add 1d4 to its saving throws against the condition corresponding to the chosen virture until the end of its next long rest. The conditions are as follows: &Reference[frightened] (bravery), &Reference[poisoned] (hardiness), or &Reference[charmed] (wit).

This weapon's properties, which are inspired by the zodiac constellations, are learned as the weapon increases in power.

Alder's Travelling Garden (Legendary).description:

Plants on the weapon require no light or nourishment to thrive. A maximum of six plants can live on the weapon. You can choose to remove any of the plants that have taken root.

Kitchen Garden. The weapon produces three nourishing berries (as per the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGoodberry0]{goodberry } spell) each dawn.

Bursting with Life. When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with an attack from this weapon, plants burst from the target's body, growing rapidly in a 30-foot radius centered on the target, creating difficult terrain. When a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the creature must succeed on a [[/save dexterity 18]]saving throw or trip over the plants, falling &Reference[prone]. Mist Guardian (Legnedary).name: Mist Guardian (Legnedary)
Mist Guardian (Legnedary).description:
Misty Dew. While holding this magic weapon, you can use a bonus action to cause your space to be lightly obscured by a refreshing spray of cool mist. This mist disappears after 1 minute, or when you use this property again.

Ixkakaw's Virtue. Once per long rest, while holding this weapon, you can use an action to create a rainbow arch in your space. Creatures of your choice that can see the rainbow can use their reaction to regain 2d4 hit points and neutralize one poison affecting it.

Rain of Renewal. Once per long rest, while holding this weapon, you can use an action to cause a pleasant-smelling rain to fall from the sky in a 10-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on you, which lightly obscures the area. The rain moves with you and falls for 1 minute, or until you dismiss it as a bonus action. Creatures within the rain immediately end any of the following conditions affecting them: &Reference[blinded], &Reference[paralyzed], &Reference[poisoned], or &Reference[stunned].

Bird of Paradise. Once per long rest, you can use an action to summon a toucan spirit from the weapon. The spirit disappears after 1 minute or when it drops to 0 hit points.

The spirit is an ally to you and your companions. In combat, the spirit shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you do not issue any, it takes the Dodge action and uses its move to avoid danger. While the spirit is summoned, you cannot use Ixkakaw's Virtue or Rain of Renewal.

Trouble Clef (Rare).name: Trouble Clef (Rare)
Trouble Clef (Rare).description:
Progression: Trouble Clef progresses whenever the attuned creature gains an Ability Score Improvement.

While holding this magic weapon, you can use an action to transform it into any musical instrument with which you are proficient, or back into its weapon form.

Paramount. When you roll initiative while carrying this weapon, you add your proficiency bonus to your initiative roll.

Bass Note. When you hit with an attack using this weapon, you can choose to expend a spell slot to deal an extra [[/r 1d8[thunder]]]{1d8 thunder damage} per level of the slot expended to the target. Creatures within 5 feet of the target must make a [[/save con dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] saving throw against your spell save DC, taking the same amount of damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Serpent's Tongue (Very Rare).name: Serpent's Tongue (Very Rare)
Serpent's Tongue (Very Rare).description:
Progression: Serpent's Tongue progresses each time its wielder succeeds at persuading or deceiving a creature into giving up something it does not want to part with. The creature tricked must have a CR that is at least one higher than the wielder's level, and cannot be &Reference[charmed] or otherwise ensorcelled by magic. The creature's proficiency bonus must increase before the item can increase in power again.

You gain proficiency in the Deception skill. If you are already proficient, you gain expertise instead.

Forked Tongue. When you make a [[/skill deception]] check, you can roll [[/roll 1d6]] and add the number rolled to the check. If you use this property and your check fails, the creature you made the check against becomes unfriendly or hostile toward you (the GM decides).

Mind Venom. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can choose to deal psychic damage instead of piercing damage.

Erode Confidence. If you succeed on a Charisma (Deception) or Charisma (Persuasion) check against a creature, it is &Reference[charmed] by you for 1 hour, or until you, or an ally, attack it or cast a spell on it. If the creature remains &Reference[charmed] for the duration, its attitude toward you afterward remains neutral or friendly until you take a hostile action toward it. You can use this property a number of times equal to half your proficiency bonus and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

  • Goatshape. You transform yourself into a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmGoat0000000000]{goat}, as per the polymorph spell.

  • Form of Krampus. Your body takes on several of Krampus' physical traits and special attacks.

    • Cloven Hooves. Your feet transform into cloven hooves. You have advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock you &Reference[prone], and your movement is unaffected by difficult terrain.

    • Horns. Long, pointed horns erupt from your skull. For the duration, you gain the following magical attack and ability.

      • Ram. Melee Weapon Attack (Horns): Proficiency Bonus plus STR Modifier to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 3d6 + STR Modifier piercing damage.

      • Charge. If you move at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hit it with a Ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra [[/r 3d6[piercing]]]{3d6 piercing damage}.

The Hunger (Legendary).name: The Hunger (Legendary)
The Hunger (Legendary).description:
As this magic weapon progresses, it unlocks properties known as Bestial Aspects. Activating or deactivating an Aspect uses a bonus action. Aspects last until you finish a long rest. You can have [[@prof/2]] Aspects active at once. If you try to exceed your maximum number of Aspects, the oldest Aspect immediately ends, and then the new Aspect applies. The saving throw DC for Aspects is [[8 + @prof + @abilities.str.mod]].

Aspect of the Goat. You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

Aspect of the Lion. If you move at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hit them with an attack using this weapon, they must succeed on a [[/save strength]] saving throw or be knocked &Reference[prone].

Aspect of the Dragon. When you score a critical hit with this weapon, a cone of fire erupts from it in a direction you choose as if you cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBurningHan]{burning hands} (save DC equal to your Aspect save DC).

Aspect of the Wyvern. Once per short or long rest, when you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, you can force it to succeed on a [[/save constitution]] saving throw against your Aspect save DC or become &Reference[poisoned] for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

Aspect of the Predator. When you kill a creature with an attack using this weapon, you gain temporary hit points equal to its challenge rating. In addition, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

Once per long rest, while this Aspect is active, you can choose to gain hyper-acute senses for 1 hour. For the duration, you can detect the location of any creatures within 1,000 feet that are missing any of their hit points. You can home in on a specific creature and if the creature is moving, you know the direction of its movement. Additionally, your movement speed is increased by 10 feet.

Aspect of the Wyvern.name: Aspect of the Wyvern
Aspect of the Wyvern.condition: When you hit a creature with this weapon

Hivetender's Edge (Legendary).name: Hivetender's Edge (Legendary)
Hivetender's Edge (Legendary).description:
Signature Weapon. When anyone but the person attuned to this magic weapon picks it up, it emits a high-pitched noise (audible up to 100 feet away) for 10 minutes, without stopping. This includes the first 10 minutes of the attunement process. You can choose to turn this ability off.

Radiant Blade. In dim light or darkness, the weapon glows, emitting bright light in a 30-foot-radius sphere. You can choose to turn this ability off.

Shield of Light. The weapon projects a circle of shimmering force around itself, granting a +2 bonus to AC. Shield of Light counts as a shield for any feats, class features, or other abilities that apply to shields. This can apply to up to two creatures of your choice who are within 5 feet of you.

Hive Thoughts. The weapon picks up the thoughts of insects within 30 feet and telepathically communicates them to its wielder. This is not usually terribly useful, or comprehensible. You can choose to tune these thoughts out or focus on a particular thought.

Forceful Critical. When you score a critical hit on an attack with this weapon, it deals an extra [[/r 2d6[force]]]{2d6 force damage}.

Ruldar's Steeds (Uncommon).name: Ruldar's Steeds (Uncommon)
Ruldar's Steeds (Uncommon).description:
Progression: Ruldar's Steeds progresses whenever the attuned creature's proficiency bonus increases.

Animal Love. While attuned to this magic weapon, you gain proficiency with the Animal Handling skill. If you are already proficient, you gain expertise instead.

Honorable Steed. Once per long rest, while holding this weapon, you can use an action to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFindSteed0]{find steed}. When cast this way, the spell summons Lula, a giant lizard. All steeds summoned by this spell are Fey.

Eclipse's Edge (Common).name: Eclipse's Edge (Common)
Eclipse's Edge (Common).description:
Progression: Eclipse's Edge progresses as its wielder performs acts that maintain or restore balance between opposing forces. Significant achievements are determined by the GM, but may include reconciling feuding factions or vanquishing a creature threatening to disrupt the world's natural order.

While holding this magic weapon, you can use an action to instantaneously light or snuff a candle, torch, or small campfire within 30 feet. In addition, you can use an action to cast the light cantrip, targeting this weapon.

The Hunger (Common).name: The Hunger (Common)
The Hunger (Common).description:
Progression: The Hunger progresses each time its wielder kills an exceptionally powerful Beast or Monstrosity, as determined by the GM.

As this magic weapon progresses, it unlocks properties known as Bestial Aspects. Activating or deactivating an Aspect uses a bonus action. Aspects last until you finish a long rest. You can have [[@prof/2]] Aspects active at once. If you try to exceed your maximum number of Aspects, the oldest Aspect immediately ends, and then the new Aspect applies. The saving throw DC for Aspects is [[8 + @prof + @abilities.str.mod]].

Aspect of the Goat. You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

Glyph (Very Rare).name: Glyph (Very Rare)
Glyph (Very Rare).description:
Progression: Glyph progresses as the attuned creature grows in magical power. The weapon's rarity increases each time the wielder gains spell slots of the following levels: 7th level (legendary).

You are proficient with this magic weapon even if you are not proficient with longswords. In addition, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplComprehend]{comprehend languages} using your spellcasting ability and spell slots.

Arcane Resistance. Twice per long rest, if you fail a saving throw against a spell or other magical effect, you can choose to expend a spell slot to reroll. If you do so, you must use the new roll. In addition, when you use Arcane Resistance on a saving throw against an area of effect spell and succeed on your reroll, all creatures of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of you can reroll their saving throws against the same effect.

Cleave Magic. While holding this weapon, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplCounterspe]{counterspell} using your spellcasting ability and spell slots. Once per long rest, when a creature within 5 feet of you casts a spell, you can use your reaction to cast counterspell without expending a spell slot.

Deflect Magic. If a creature makes a spell attack against you, you can use your reaction to expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher to impose disadvantage on the creature's attack roll. You can use this property [[@prof/2]] times and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

My Lady's Favor (Rare).name: My Lady's Favor (Rare)
My Lady's Favor (Rare).description:
Progression: My Lady's Favor progresses whenever the attuned creature's proficiency bonus increases.

Appropriately Dressed. While this magic weapon is on your person, you can use a bonus action to change the appearance of your clothing to something appropriate to the current situation. You can also remove bloodstains, damage, or other imperfections.

Appropriately Charming. You gain proficiency in the Persuasion skill. If you are already proficient, you gain expertise instead.

Appropriately Vicious. Once per long rest, you can use a bonus action to increase your Strength score by a number equal to your proficiency bonus (to a maximum of 22). This increase lasts for 10 minutes.

Devouring Anvil (Common).name: Devouring Anvil (Common)
Devouring Anvil (Common).description:
Progression: Devouring Anvil progresses whenever the attuned creature's proficiency bonus increases.

Metamorphic Form. You can use a bonus action to change the composition of this magic weapon to either iron, quartz, silver, or wood.

My Lady's Favor (Legendary).name: My Lady's Favor (Legendary)
My Lady's Favor (Legendary).description:
Appropriately Dressed. While this magic weapon is on your person, you can use a bonus action to change the appearance of your clothing to something appropriate to the current situation. You can also remove bloodstains, damage, or other imperfections.

Appropriately Charming. You gain proficiency in the Persuasion skill. If you are already proficient, you gain expertise instead.

Appropriately Vicious. Once per long rest, you can use a bonus action to increase your Strength score by a number equal to your proficiency bonus (to a maximum of 25). This increase lasts for 10 minutes.

Appropriately Devastating. The weapon has 3 charges, and regains 1d3 expended charges when you finish a long rest. When you hit with an attack using this weapon, you can use your reaction to expend 1 charge to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplShatter000]{shatter }as a 4th-level spell (save DC 17) centered on this weapon. You are unaffected by the spell.

My Lady's Favor (Uncommon).name: My Lady's Favor (Uncommon)
My Lady's Favor (Uncommon).description:
Progression: My Lady's Favor progresses whenever the attuned creature's proficiency bonus increases.

Appropriately Charming. You gain proficiency in the Persuasion skill. If you are already proficient, you gain expertise instead.

Longsword (Very Rare).name: Longsword (Very Rare)
Longsword (Very Rare).description:
Progression: Counterpoise progresses whenever the attuned creature's Wisdom modifier increases.

Counterpoise is a nonmagical weapon that becomes magical when one of its properties is used.

Advantageous Attack. Twice per long rest, when you make an attack with this weapon, you can choose to attack with advantage. Doing so also makes the weapon magical until the end of your next turn.

Tip the Scales. You can expend up to 4 charges to gain a bonus to attack and damage rolls with this weapon equal to the number of charges expended for 1 minute. Doing so also makes the weapon magical for the duration.

Bow of Empee (Rare).name: Bow of Empee (Rare)
Bow of Empee (Rare).description:
Progression: The Bow of Empee progresses whenever the attuned creature's proficiency bonus increases.

HUD. While holding this magic weapon, you can use a bonus action to activate or deactivate a heads-up display that appears in front of you. The display contains all options listed below, though those that require a rarity level above the weapon's current rarity are grayed out and unavailable. The display is visible to all creatures and disappears if you let go of the weapon. A crosshairs icon is highlighted on the HUD when you make a damage roll with this weapon.

Auto Reload. The weapon cannot use normal ammunition. Instead, it produces its own, creating one piece of magical ammunition when you make a ranged attack with it. The ammunition created by the weapon vanishes the instant after it hits or misses a target.

Psychological Warfare. Once per long rest, you can cause the weapon to produce menacing, glowing-red spikes for 1 minute. For the duration, you have advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks.

Arcane Ammo. The weapon has 4 charges, and it regains 1d3 + 1 expended charges when you finish a long rest. Prior to making your attack, you can expend a number of charges to empower the created ammunition with one of the following spell effects: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMelfsAcidA]{acid arrow} (2 charges) and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGuidingBol]{guiding bolt} (1 charge). You can also empower the ammunition with @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFireBolt00]{fire bolt} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplRayofFrost]{ray of frost}, requiring no charges. Empowered ammunition does not deal its normal piercing damage. A missed attack results in expended charges and no spell effect.

Mariway's Staff (Very Rare).name: Mariway's Staff (Very Rare)
Mariway's Staff (Very Rare).description:
Progression: Mariway's Staff progresses whenever the attuned creature's Wisdom modifier increases.

Mariway's Cost. When you attune to this magic weapon, you must permanently sacrifice one Hit Die to the weapon. You remove this Hit Die from your pool but regain it when your attunement to this weapon ends. The size of the sacrificed die is the size of your Cost die, which is used for properties gained as this weapon progresses.

Mariway's Health. While holding this weapon, you can use a bonus action to expend a 1st-level spell slot to regain hit points equal to your Cost die roll + your spellcasting ability modifier. You can expend a higher level spell slot (up to a maximum of 4th level) to increase the healing by one Cost die for each slot level above 1st.

Mariway's Armor. You gain a +1 bonus to AC while holding this weapon.

Whisperwind (Common).name: Whisperwind (Common)
Whisperwind (Common).description:
Progression: Whisperwind progresses as the attuned creature bests elements of wind. Specific milestones are determined by the GM, but may include defending nature, or surviving natural or magical storms.

While holding this magic weapon, you can use an action to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMessage000]{message}.

Silent Strings (Very Rare).name: Silent Strings (Very Rare)
Silent Strings (Very Rare).description:
Progression: For Silent Strings to progress, the attuned creature must locate a lost song or poem unknown to any living being. When its tune or rhythm is strummed on the lyre's strings, the weapon's rarity increases. The creature's proficiency bonus must increase before the item can progress again.

Once per long rest, while holding the instrument, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSilence000]{silence}.

Once per long rest, while holding the instrument, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGreaterInv]{greater invisibility}.

Instrument or Weapon. You can use an action to change this magic item's form into an instrument (lyre) or a weapon (whip), or back again. Ati will, while holding the instrument, you can cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMessage000]{message} cantrip.

Stolen Stories. When you damage a creature with the weapon, the target must make a [[/save wisdom 17]]saving throw. On a failed save, you learn a significant story or anecdote about the target. The story might be a secret, a key motivation, a weakness, or a strength. The story might include poetry or a song, as determined by the</p><p><strong>GM.</strong> You can use this property a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Taurus.name: Taurus
Taurus.description: Your Strength increases by 2, to a maximum of 22, for a number of hours equal to your proficiency bonus.

Pilum of the Lost Legion (Legendary).name: Pilum of the Lost Legion (Legendary)
Pilum of the Lost Legion (Legendary).description:
Living Banner. While holding this magic weapon, and while no friendly creature is within 10 feet of you, you have have immunity from being pushed or knocked &Reference[prone].

Stand Like a Bastion. Once per long rest, if you are within 5 feet of an enemy, and no friendly creature is within 10 feet of you, you can use a bonus action to enter a defensive stance. While in this stance, you have advantage on attack rolls against creatures within 5 feet of you and you add your proficiency bonus to your AC and the damage you deal with this weapon. You can remain in the stance for 1 minute, or until you are &Reference[incapacitated].

While in the defensive stance of Stand Like a Bastion, having 0 hit points does not knock you &Reference[unconscious]. You still must make death saving throws, and you suffer the normal effects of taking damage while at 0 hit points. However, if you would die due to failing death saving throws, you do not die until your stance ends, and you die then only if you still have 0 hit points. In addition, you are immune to being &Reference[grappled], &Reference[incapacitated], &Reference[paralyzed], &Reference[petrified], &Reference[restrained], &Reference[stunned], or &Reference[unconscious] while in this stance.

Trident of R'lyeh (Legendary).name: Trident of R'lyeh (Legendary)
Trident of R'lyeh (Legendary).description:
Curse of Cthulhu. A creature attuned to the weapon cannot end the attunement voluntarily. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGreaterRes]{greater restoration} spell breaks the attunement, but it takes it takes ([[/r 1d6 + @prof]]{1d6 + proficiency}) days for their body to return to its original appearance.

When you attune to this magic weapon, tiny gills appear on your neck. You can breathe underwater indefnitely.

Blessing of the Deep Ones. Your feet and hands become webbed. You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

Return. The weapon returns to your hand immediately after it is used to make a ranged attack.

Shocking Stab. When you hit with an attack using this weapon, you can expend 1 charge to deal an extra [[/r 3d8[lightning]]]{3d8 lightning damage}, and the target cannot take reactions until the start of its next turn.

Blessing of Mother Hydra. Your eyes change shape, becoming bulbous and fish-like. You gain darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision from your race, its range increases by 60 feet.

Ally from the Depths. While underwater, you can expend 3 charges to summon a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmHunterShark000]{hunter shark} or 5 charges to summon two hunter sharks. The sharks arrive in [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. The sharks are allies to you and your companions. In combat, they share your initiative count, but take their turns immediately after yours. They obey your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you do not issue any, they take the Dodge action and use their move to avoid danger. The sharks disappear after 1 hour or when they are reduced to 0 hit points, you are killed, or you dismiss them.

Blessing of Father Dagon. Your skin becomes gray and scaly, and your hair falls out. You gain resistance to cold damage.

Doom of Sunken R'lyeh. While you are within 10 miles of the sea, you can expend 7 charges to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplEarthquake]{earthquake} (save DC 19).

Blessing of Great Cthulhu. Your body fully transforms into that of a deep one (sahuagin), and you gain the following traits:

  • You have advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that does not have all its hit points.
  • You can magically command any shark within 120 feet of you, using a limited telepathy.
  • You can read, write, and speak Sahuagin.
  • Your swimming speed is 10 feet more than your walking speed.
  • If you go more than one week without becoming immersed beneath the surface of the sea, you gain one level of exhaustion each time you finish a long rest.

Whisperwind (Legendary).name: Whisperwind (Legendary)
Whisperwind (Legendary).description:
While holding this magic weapon, you can use an action to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMessage000]{message}.

Sturdy Retreat. When you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, that creature has disadvantage on opportunity attacks made against you until the start of your next turn.

Razorwind Strike. Once per long rest, when you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, you can force each creature within a 60-feet-long, 5-feet-wide line extending from the weapon in the direction of the target to make a [[/save dexterity 15]]saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes [[/r 6d6[slashing]]]{6d6 slashing damage} and is pushed 5 feet in a direction of your choice. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is not pushed.

Gathering Gale. Once per long rest, while holding this weapon, you can use an action to gain a flying speed of 60 feet for 1 minute. While flying this way, ranged attacks made against you have disadvantage.

Tempest-Toss. Once per long rest, if a creature scores a critical hit against you, you can use your reaction to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplStormofVen]{storm of vengeance} (save DC 17).

Brazen Hammer (Common).name: Brazen Hammer (Common)
Brazen Hammer (Common).description:
Progression: Brazen Hammer progresses whenever the attuned creature's proficiency bonus increases.

Hell-Touched. This magic weapon is permanently warm. It is uncomfortable (but not damaging) to touch without gloves.

Hammer of Haughtiness (Legendary).name: Hammer of Haughtiness (Legendary)
Hammer of Haughtiness (Legendary).description:
Once per short or long rest, while holding this magic weapon, you can use a bonus action to gain darkvision out to a range of 60 feet for 1 minute.

This weapon deals an additional [[/r 2d6[bludgeoning]]]{2d6 bludgeoning damage} to creatures with an Intelligence score of 9 or less.

Hoot. Once per short or long rest, while holding this weapon, you can use an action to cause it to emit a loud hooting noise. Any creature within 30 feet of you that can hear must succeed on a [[/save constitution 19]]saving throw or be &Reference[stunned] until the start of your next turn. Creatures with an Intelligence score of 9 or less have disadvantage on the saving throw.

Mind Bonk. When you score a critical hit with this weapon against a creature that has an Intelligence score of 10 or higher, the target must succeed on a [[/save intelligence 19]]saving throw or have its Intelligence score reduced to 9 until it finishes a long rest.

Hag's ladle (Rare).name: Hag's ladle (Rare)
Hag's ladle (Rare).description:
Progression: Hag's Ladle progresses whenever its wielder defeats a hag, witch, or similar malevolent entity, whether by force of arms, or by trickery and guile.

While attuned to this magic weapon, when you finish a long rest, you gain proficiency in your choice of Arcana, Medicine, or Nature for 12 hours.

The weapon has 3 charges, and regains 1 charge whenever you prepare a meal during a short rest, or 3 charges if you prepare a meal during a long rest.

Your Charisma score is reduced by 1 as you develop unsightly warts, but your Constitution and Wisdom scores increase by 1, to a maximum of 20.

Indigestion. You can use a bonus action to expend 1 charge while targeting a creature you can see within 60 feet of you, giving it a bout of severe stomach discomfort. The creature must succeed on a [[/save constitution 15]]saving throw or take [[/r 3d6[acid]]]{3d6 acid damage} and have disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws until the end of its next turn. Creatures that lack a digestive system are immune to this effect

Flowing Water Blade (Common).name: Flowing Water Blade (Common)
Flowing Water Blade (Common).description:
Progression: Flowing Water Blade progresses whenever the attuned creature's proficiency bonus increases.

One With the Current. While holding this magic weapon, you have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

The Hunger (Rare).name: The Hunger (Rare)
The Hunger (Rare).description:
Progression: The Hunger progresses each time its wielder kills an exceptionally powerful Beast or Monstrosity, as determined by the GM.

You can have [[@prof/2]] Aspects active at once. If you try to exceed your maximum number of Aspects, the oldest Aspect immediately ends, and then the new Aspect applies. The saving throw DC for Aspects is [[8 + @prof + @abilities.str.mod]].

Aspect of the Goat. You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

Aspect of the Lion. If you move at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hit them with an attack using this weapon, they must succeed on a [[/save strength]] saving throw or be knocked &Reference[prone].

Aspect of the Dragon. When you score a critical hit with this weapon, a cone of fire erupts from it in a direction you choose as if you cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBurningHan]{burning hands} (save DC equal to your Aspect save DC).

Tidal Lash (Uncommon).name: Tidal Lash (Uncommon)
Tidal Lash (Uncommon).description:
Progression: Tidal Lash is bound to the ocean goddess who created it, and progresses each time its wielder performs an important task for her, as determined by the GM. The goddess favors wielders who protect the oceans, slay terrible sea monsters, and embark on long ocean voyages to undiscovered places.

Attacks made with this magic weapon while underwater do not impose disadvantage.

Riptide. When you hit with an attack using this weapon, you can expend 1 charge to slam the target with a heavy wave. The target must succeed on a [[/save strength 13]]saving throw or be pushed 10 feet in a direction of your choice.

Tomato Vine (Common).name: Tomato Vine (Common)
Tomato Vine (Common).description:
Progression: Tomato Vine progresses whenever the attuned creature's proficiency bonus increases.

Ammunition. If you load no ammunition in this magic weapon, it produces its own, automatically creating one tomato (which counts as magic ammunition) when you make a ranged attack with it. Ammunition created by the weapon rots into goo 1 minute after being created.

Mist Guardian (Rare).name: Mist Guardian (Rare)
Mist Guardian (Rare).description:
Progression: Mist Guardian progresses whenever the attuned creature's proficiency bonus increases.

Misty Dew. While holding this magic weapon, you can use a bonus action to cause your space to be lightly obscured by a refreshing spray of cool mist. This mist disappears after 1 minute, or when you use this property again.

Ixkakaw's Virtue. Once per long rest, while holding this weapon, you can use an action to create a rainbow arch in your space. Creatures of your choice that can see the rainbow can use their reaction to regain 2d4 hit points and neutralize one poison affecting it.

Rain of Renewal. Once per long rest, while holding this weapon, you can use an action to cause a pleasant-smelling rain to fall from the sky in a 10-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on you, which lightly obscures the area. The rain moves with you and falls for 1 minute, or until you dismiss it as a bonus action. Creatures within the rain immediately end any of the following conditions affecting them: &Reference[blinded], &Reference[paralyzed], &Reference[poisoned], or &Reference[stunned].

Whispers of Treason (Common).name: Whispers of Treason (Common)
Whispers of Treason (Common).description:
Progression: Whispers of Treason progresses when it consumes enough souls, as determined by the GM.

This magic weapon can only be destroyed by an effect that would destroy an artifact.

Sentience. Whispers of Treason is a sentient lawful evil weapon with an Intelligence of 11, a Wisdom of 12, and a Charisma of 14. It has hearing and darkvision out to a range of 120 feet, and can speak, read, and understand Common and Infernal.

The weapon seeks to ingratiate itself with a powerful person, then convince or trick them into acquiring souls for it. Its aim is to acquire enough souls to descend to a more powerful form of devil, freeing itself from its bow form in the process. Conflict arises if the wielder refuses to aid Whisper's schemes.

Mariway's Staff (Common).name: Mariway's Staff (Common)
Mariway's Staff (Common).description:
Progression: Mariway's Staff progresses whenever the attuned creature's Wisdom modifier increases.

Mariway's Cost. When you attune to this magic weapon, you must permanently sacrifice one Hit Die to the weapon. You remove this Hit Die from your pool but regain it when your attunement to this weapon ends. The size of the sacrificed die is the size of your Cost die, which is used for properties gained as this weapon progresses.

Osterot's Hand (Legendary).name: Osterot's Hand (Legendary)
Osterot's Hand (Legendary).description:
Piercing Stab. You can use this magic bow as a melee weapon with the finesse property. When used this way, the weapon deals [[/r 1d8[piercing]]]{1d8 piercing damage} on a hit.

Parry. You can use your reaction to add 3 to your AC against one melee attack that would hit you. To do so, you must see the attacker and be wielding this weapon.

Silvered Ammunition. The weapon no longer requires ammunition. Instead, when you draw the weapon's string, a piece of silvered ammunition appears. This ammunition disappears after hitting its target.

Constellation (Legendary).name: Constellation (Legendary)
Constellation (Legendary).description:
Progression: Constellation progresses whenever the attuned creature's proficiency bonus increases.

This weapon's properties, which are inspired by the zodiac constellations, are learned as the weapon increases in power.

When you attune to this magic weapon or progress from the previous stage, you learn all remaining Constellations.

Glyph (Common).name: Glyph (Common)
Glyph (Common).description:
Progression: Glyph progresses as the attuned creature grows in magical power. The weapon's rarity increases each time the wielder gains spell slots of the following levels: 2nd level (uncommon), 3rd level (rare), 5th level (very rare), and 7th level (legendary).

The Hunger (Uncommon).description:

Bluefire (Very Rare).name: Bluefire (Very Rare)
Bluefire (Very Rare).description:
Progression: Bluefire progresses whenever the attuned creature's Wisdom modifier increases.

Bluefire. Once per long rest, while holding this magic weapon, you can use a bonus action to speak the command word to cause the head to emit blue flames for [[@prof]] hours. You can speak the command word again (no action required) to end the effect early. While the flames have no heat, they cast bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. While this is active, the weapon deals [[@prof]] extra fire damage on a hit.

Azure Eruption. Once per short or long rest, while Bluefire is active, you can use an action to speak the command word to cause it to unleash a 30-foot cone of blue fire. Each creature in this area must make a [[/save dexterity 16]]saving throw, taking [[/r 3d6[fire]]]{3d6 fire damage} on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

This weapon deals an additional [[/r 1d6[bludgeoning]]]{1d6 bludgeoning damage} to creatures with an Intelligence score of 9 or less.

Trident of R'lyeh (Rare).name: Trident of R'lyeh (Rare)
Trident of R'lyeh (Rare).description:

Eruption. Once per long rest, as an action, you can speak the command word while raising the weapon above your head, causing molten lava to erupt from it. Each creature within a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on the weapon (including you) must make a [[/save dexterity 15]]saving throw. A target takes [[/r 8d6[fire]]]{8d6 fire damage} on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The eruption does not spread around corners but does ignite flammable objects in the area that are not being worn or carried.

Flare's Reach (Light). When you attack with this weapon, you can increase your reach by 5 feet.

Subtle Shadows (Dark). You can use a bonus action to reduce this weapon to one-tenth its size (roughly the size of a dagger), making it easy to conceal. While this size, it cannot be used to make attacks. It remains this size for 1 hour, or until you use a bonus action to return it to normal size.

Solar Flare (Light). Once per long rest, you can use an action to create a brilliant flare of light in a 60-foot-radius sphere centered on you. Creatures in the area (excluding you) must succeed on a [[/save constitution 17]]saving throw or be &Reference[blinded] until the end of their next turn.

Starfall (Dark). Once per long rest, you can use an action to cause small comets to crash in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you can see within 100 feet. Each creature in this area must make a [[/save dexterity 17]]saving throw, taking [[/r 4d10[bludgeoning]]]{4d10 bludgeoning damage} on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. At the end of your turn, you can teleport anywhere within the former area of effect.

Once per long rest, you can use a bonus action to activate one of the following properties and alter your form for 10 minutes.

Brilliant Form (Light). You are infused with radiant energy. You gain resistance to necrotic damage and a +2 bonus to AC. In addition, whenever a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack, the attacker takes [[/r 2d8[radiant]]]{2d8 radiant damage}.

Shadow Form (Dark). You are infused with necrotic energy, covering you in shadows. You gain resistance to radiant damage and attack rolls against you have disadvantage.

Trouble Clef (Very Rare).name: Trouble Clef (Very Rare)
Trouble Clef (Very Rare).description:
Progression: Trouble Clef progresses whenever the attuned creature gains an Ability Score Improvement.

While holding this magic weapon, you can use an action to transform it into any musical instrument with which you are proficient, or back into its weapon form.

Paramount. When you roll initiative while carrying this weapon, you add your proficiency bonus to your initiative roll.

Bass Note. When you hit with an attack using this weapon, you can choose to expend a spell slot to deal an extra [[/r 1d8[thunder]]]{1d8 thunder damage} per level of the slot expended to the target. Creatures within 5 feet of the target must make a [[/save con dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] saving throw against your spell save DC, taking the same amount of damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Irrepressible. You cannot be &Reference[deafened] while wielding this weapon and you are unaffected by spells and other magical effects that prevent you from casting spells with verbal components.

Trouble Clef (Common).name: Trouble Clef (Common)
Trouble Clef (Common).description:
Progression: Trouble Clef progresses whenever the attuned creature gains an Ability Score Improvement.

While holding this magic weapon, you can use an action to transform it into any musical instrument with which you are proficient, or back into its weapon form.

Osterot's Hand (Common).name: Osterot's Hand (Common)
Osterot's Hand (Common).description:
Progression: Osterot's Hand progresses whenever the attuned creature's Wisdom modifier increases.

Piercing Stab. You can use this magic bow as a melee weapon with the finesse property. When used this way, the weapon deals [[/r 1d4[piercing]]]{1d4 piercing damage} on a hit.

Rising Tide (Very Rare).name: Rising Tide (Very Rare)
Rising Tide (Very Rare).description:
Progression: Rising Tide progresses whenever the attuned creature's proficiency bonus increases.

Attacks made with this magic weapon while underwater do not impose disadvantage.

Tidal Reach. You can use a bonus action to mentally command the weapon's haft to extend into a ten-footlong tentacle tipped with the mace's pearlescent conch head, granting it the reach property.

Master of Tides. While holding this weapon, you can use an action to expend a number of charges to cast one of the following spells:

  • 2 charges: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplAlterSelf0]{alter self}

  • 3 charges: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplConjureAni]{conjure animals}

  • 4 charges: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplControlWat]{control water}

You can expend additional charges to increase the spell slot level of these spells by one for each additional charge expended. When you cast alter self from this weapon, you can only choose the Aquatic Adaptation benefit, and when you cast conjure animals from it, the spirits you summon must take the form of creatures who make their home in the ocean.

Tidal Shield. When you are hit with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to expend 1 charge to push your attacker 20 feet away from you with a jet of water.

Silent Strings (Uncommon).name: Silent Strings (Uncommon)
Silent Strings (Uncommon).description:
Progression: For Silent Strings to progress, the attuned creature must locate a lost song or poem unknown to any living being. When its tune or rhythm is strummed on the lyre's strings, the weapon's rarity increases. The creature's proficiency bonus must increase before the item can progress again.

Once per long rest, while holding the instrument, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSilence000]{silence}.

Instrument or Weapon. You can use an action to change this magic item's form into an instrument (lyre) or a weapon (whip), or back again. Ati will, while holding the instrument, you can cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMessage000]{message} cantrip.

Longsword (Legendary).name: Longsword (Legendary)
Longsword (Legendary).description:
Counterpoise is a nonmagical weapon that becomes magical when one of its properties is used.

Advantageous Attack. Twice per long rest, when you make an attack with this weapon, you can choose to attack with advantage. Doing so also makes the weapon magical until the end of your next turn.

Tip the Scales. You can expend up to 5 charges to gain a bonus to attack and damage rolls with this weapon equal to the number of charges expended for 1 minute. Doing so also makes the weapon magical for the duration.

Hearthfriend (Common).name: Hearthfriend (Common)
Hearthfriend (Common).description:
Progression: Hearthfriend progresses the first time its wielder cooks a meal for their friends after each proficiency bonus increase, or during other important meals, at the GM's discretion.

Heroic Meal. When finishing a long rest, you can cook and eat a heroic meal. You gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus (or twice your bonus if you are a Halfling).

Brazen Hammer (Uncommon).name: Brazen Hammer (Uncommon)
Brazen Hammer (Uncommon).description:
Progression: Brazen Hammer progresses whenever the attuned creature's proficiency bonus increases.

You have resistance to fire damage while holding this weapon.

Hell-Touched. This magic weapon is permanently warm. It is uncomfortable (but not damaging) to touch without gloves.

Eclipse's Reach (Rare).name: Eclipse's Reach (Rare)
Eclipse's Reach (Rare).description:
Progression: Eclipse's Reach progresses whenever the attuned creature's proficiency bonus increases.

Eclipse's Reach has Light and Dark properties, which can only be used by creatures of particular alignments and only at certain times. Light properties can only be used by good or neutral-aligned creatures and only during the day (between dawn and dusk). Dark properties can only be used by evil or neutral-aligned creatures and only during the night (between dusk and dawn).

Once per long rest, while holding this magic weapon, you can either extinguish all nonmagical flames (Dark) or light all candles, torches, and lanterns (Light) within 60 feet of you.

The weapon deals an extra [[/r 1d6[radiant]]]{1d6 radiant damage}(Light) or [[/r 1d6[necrotic]]]{1d6 necrotic damage}(Dark) on a hit. This damage increases to 2d6 against Aberrations and Monstrosities.

Flames of the Sun (Light). Once per long rest, you can use an action to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGuidingBol]{guiding bolt} (spell attack bonus +5).

Stars' Design (Dark). Once per long rest, you can use an action to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplAugury0000]{augury}.

Flare's Reach (Light). When you attack with this weapon, you can increase your reach by 5 feet.

Subtle Shadows (Dark). You can use a bonus action to reduce this weapon to one-tenth its size (roughly the size of a dagger), making it easy to conceal. While this size, it cannot be used to make attacks. It remains this size for 1 hour, or until you use a bonus action to return it to normal size.

Bellier's Razorfin (Very Rare).name: Bellier's Razorfin (Very Rare)
Bellier's Razorfin (Very Rare).description:
Progression: Bellier's Razorfin progresses whenever the attuned creature's proficiency bonus increases.

Propellers. While holding this magic weapon, you can cause the fin blades to spin like propellers, granting you a swimming speed of 30 feet until the end of your turn.

Burst of Spinning Blades. When you hit with an attack using this weapon, creatures (other than you) within 5 feet of the target must succeed on a [[/save dexterity 15]]saving throw or take [[/r 1d6[slashing]]]{1d6 slashing damage}.

Fish Reel. When you hit with an attack using this weapon, you can pull the target 10 feet toward you if it is your size or smaller. It must then succeed on a [[/save strength 15]]saving throw or be &Reference[grappled] (escape DC 15). While &Reference[grappled], the target is also &Reference[restrained].

Bluefire (Common).name: Bluefire (Common)
Bluefire (Common).description:
Progression: Bluefire progresses whenever the attuned creature's Wisdom modifier increases.

Bluefire. Once per long rest, while holding this magic weapon, you can use a bonus action to speak the command word to cause the head to emit blue flames for 1 hour. You can speak the command word again (no action required) to end the effect early. While the flames have no heat, they cast bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

Greataxe (Rare).name: Greataxe (Rare)
Greataxe (Rare).description:
Progression: Master Key progresses whenever the attuned creature's proficiency bonus increases.

Breaker of Doors. You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls against doors and locks made with this magic weapon.

Tools. Once per short or long rest, you can use a bonus action to speak the command word, causing the weapon to transform into a mundane set of thieves' tools for 10 minutes. You gain proficiency with thieves' tools while using the weapon this way. You can speak the command word again to end the transformation early.

Knock. Once per long rest, you can use a bonus action to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplKnock00000]{knock}.

Pilum of the Lost Legion (Common).name: Pilum of the Lost Legion (Common)
Pilum of the Lost Legion (Common).description:
Progression: Pilum of the Lost Legion progresses each time its wielder uses it to kill a creature with a CR that is 3 or more higher than their level. The wielder must use the spear to deal at least one third of the damage required to kill the creature. Once the spear has progressed, it cannot do so again until the wielder's level increases.

Living Banner. While holding this magic weapon, and while no friendly creature is within 10 feet of you, you have advantage on saving throws against being pushed or knocked &Reference[prone].

Hammer of Haughtiness (Very Rare).name: Hammer of Haughtiness (Very Rare)
Hammer of Haughtiness (Very Rare).description:
Progression: Hammer of Haughtiness progresses whenever the attuned creature's proficiency bonus increases.

Once per short or long rest, while holding this magic weapon, you can use a bonus action to gain darkvision out to a range of 60 feet for 1 minute.

This weapon deals an additional [[/r 2d6[bludgeoning]]]{2d6 bludgeoning damage} to creatures with an Intelligence score of 9 or less.

Hoot. Once per short or long rest, while holding this weapon, you can use an action to cause it to emit a loud hooting noise. Any creature within 30 feet of you that can hear must succeed on a [[/save constitution 17]]saving throw or be &Reference[stunned] until the start of your next turn. Creatures with an Intelligence score of 9 or less have disadvantage on the saving throw.

Serpent's Tongue (Legendary).name: Serpent's Tongue (Legendary)
Serpent's Tongue (Legendary).description:
You gain proficiency in the Deception skill. If you are already proficient, you gain expertise instead.

Forked Tongue. When you make a [[/skill deception]] check, you can roll [[/roll 1d6]] and add the number rolled to the check. If you use this property and your check fails, the creature you made the check against becomes unfriendly or hostile toward you (the GM decides).

Mind Venom. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can choose to deal psychic damage instead of piercing damage.

Erode Confidence. If you succeed on a Charisma (Deception) or Charisma (Persuasion) check against a creature, it is &Reference[charmed] by you for 1 hour, or until you, or an ally, attack it or cast a spell on it. If the creature remains &Reference[charmed] for the duration, its attitude toward you afterward remains neutral or friendly until you take a hostile action toward it. You can use this property a number of times equal to half your proficiency bonus and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Slippery Tongue. You are immune to being &Reference[charmed], and to spells and magical effects that force you to tell the truth, such as zone of truth. Truth-telling magic indicates you are being truthful.

Master of Lies. When you make a [[/skill deception]] check, you treat a d20 roll of 9 or lower as a 10. Additionally, when you fail a Charisma (Deception) check, you can choose to succeed instead. If you do, you are incapable of telling a deliberate lie for 24 hours.

Rat-King (Very Rare).name: Rat-King (Very Rare)
Rat-King (Very Rare).description:
Progression: When you kill a Medium-sized creature, you can allow The Rat-King to consume its corpse, progressing from common to uncommon. For each subsequent rarity, the required size of corpse increases by one category, to a maximum of Gargantuan. Each consumption takes [[/r 1d4 #days]]{1d4 days}. The Rat-King cannot progress more than once per month.

You can expend charges from this weapon to cast the following spells:

  • 1 charge: a@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplAnimalFrie]{nimal friendship}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSpeakwithA]{speak with animals}

  • 2 charges: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplAnimalMess]{animal messenger}

When you cast animal friendship or speak with animals this way, you can only target and communicate with rodents. When you cast animal messenger this way, one of the weapon's heads untangles itself and delivers your message, reappearing when the spell ends.

Vermin Speech. You can communicate in a limited manner with rats and other rodents. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you have no special ability to understand them in return. You have advantage on all Charisma checks you make to influence them.

Gnawing Wave. Once per long rest, while holding this weapon, you can use an action to swing it and unleash a 30-foot cone of hungry metal rats. Each creature in the area must make a [[/save dexterity 16]]saving throw, taking [[/r 8d6[piercing]]]{[[/r 8d6[piercing]]]{8d6 piercing damage}} on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Until the start of your next turn, the area is covered in swarming rats, making it difficult terrain.

In addition, a creature that fails its saving throw against Gnawing Wave is covered in hungry rats and must repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns. On a failure, the target takes an additional [[/r 2d6[piercing]]]{2d6 piercing damage}. On a success, the effect ends for it.

Glyph (Rare).name: Glyph (Rare)
Glyph (Rare).description:
Progression: Glyph progresses as the attuned creature grows in magical power. The weapon's rarity increases each time the wielder gains spell slots of the following levels: 5th level (very rare), and 7th level (legendary).

You are proficient with this magic weapon even if you are not proficient with longswords. In addition, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplComprehend]{comprehend languages} using your spellcasting ability and spell slots.

Arcane Resistance. Once per long rest, if you fail a saving throw against a spell or other magical effect, you can choose to expend a spell slot to reroll. If you do so, you must use the new roll.

Cleave Magic. While holding this weapon, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplCounterspe]{counterspell} using your spellcasting ability and spell slots. Once per long rest, when a creature within 5 feet of you casts a spell, you can use your reaction to cast counterspell without expending a spell slot.

Deflect Magic. If a creature makes a spell attack against you, you can use your reaction to expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher to impose disadvantage on the creature's attack roll. You can use this property [[@prof/2]] times and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Hammer of Haughtiness (Common).name: Hammer of Haughtiness (Common)
Hammer of Haughtiness (Common).description:
Progression: Hammer of Haughtiness progresses whenever the attuned creature's proficiency bonus increases.

Once per short or long rest, while holding this magic weapon, you can use a bonus action to gain darkvision out to a range of 60 feet for 1 minute.

Bow of Empee (Legendary).name: Bow of Empee (Legendary)
Bow of Empee (Legendary).description:
HUD. While holding this magic weapon, you can use a bonus action to activate or deactivate a heads-up display that appears in front of you. The display contains all options listed below, though those that require a rarity level above the weapon's current rarity are grayed out and unavailable. The display is visible to all creatures and disappears if you let go of the weapon. A crosshairs icon is highlighted on the HUD when you make a damage roll with this weapon.

Auto Reload. The weapon cannot use normal ammunition. Instead, it produces its own, creating one piece of magical ammunition when you make a ranged attack with it. The ammunition created by the weapon vanishes the instant after it hits or misses a target.

Psychological Warfare. Once per long rest, you can cause the weapon to produce menacing, glowing-red spikes for 1 minute. For the duration, you have advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks.

Arcane Ammo. The weapon has 9 charges, and it regains 1d6 + 3 expended charges when you finish a long rest. Prior to making your attack, you can expend a number of charges to empower the created ammunition with one of the following spell effects:

6 charges: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDisintegra]{disintegrate}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSunbeam000]{sunbeam}

5 charges: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFlameStrik]{flame strike}

4 charges: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplIceStorm00]{ice storm}

3 charges: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFireball00]{fireball},@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLightningB]{ lightning bolt}

2 charges: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMelfsAcidA]{acid arrow}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplScorchingR]{scorching ray}

1 charge: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGuidingBol]{guiding bolt}

0 charges: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFireBolt00]{fire bolt}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplRayofFrost]{ray of frost}

Empowered ammunition does not deal its normal piercing damage. A missed attack results in expended charges and no spell effect. Spells effects that target a point must instead target a creature or object. The spell save DC for spells which require targets to make a saving throw is 17.

Whisperwind (Very Rare).name: Whisperwind (Very Rare)
Whisperwind (Very Rare).description:
Progression: Whisperwind progresses as the attuned creature bests elements of wind. Specific milestones are determined by the GM, but may include defending nature, or surviving natural or magical storms.

While holding this magic weapon, you can use an action to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMessage000]{message}.

Sturdy Retreat. When you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, that creature has disadvantage on opportunity attacks made against you until the start of your next turn.

Razorwind Strike. Once per long rest, when you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, you can force each creature within a 60-feet-long, 5-feet-wide line extending from the weapon in the direction of the target to make a [[/save dexterity 15]]saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes [[/r 6d6[slashing]]]{6d6 slashing damage} and is pushed 5 feet in a direction of your choice. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is not pushed.

Gathering Gale. Once per long rest, while holding this weapon, you can use an action to gain a flying speed of 60 feet for 1 minute. While flying this way, ranged attacks made against you have disadvantage.

Eclipse's Edge (Legendary).name: Eclipse's Edge (Legendary)
Eclipse's Edge (Legendary).description:
Progression: Eclipse's Edge progresses as its wielder performs acts that maintain or restore balance between opposing forces. Significant achievements are determined by the GM, but may include reconciling feuding factions or vanquishing a creature threatening to disrupt the world's natural order.

While holding this magic weapon, you can use an action to instantaneously light or snuff a candle, torch, or small campfire within 30 feet. In addition, you can use an action to cast the light cantrip, targeting this weapon.

When you hit a creature with a [[@prof/2]] CR with an attack using this weapon, the weapon gains 1 charge and begins to glow.

Lunar Strike. You can use an action to expend 2 charges to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMoonbeam00]{moonbeam }(save DC 17). You can spend additional charges to cast moonbeam at a level equal to the total number of charges expended. Once you have cast moonbeam from this weapon, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

Solar Strike. You can use an action to expend 6 charges to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSunbeam000]{sunbeam }(save DC 17). Once you cast sunbeam from this weapon, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

Totality. Once per long rest, while holding this weapon, you can use an action to speak the command word, causing magical darkness to spread in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on you for 1 minute. A creature with darkvision cannot see through this darkness, and nonmagical light cannot illuminate it. When you take this action, you can designate up to six creatures that can see through the magical darkness.

Krampus Cane (Legendary).name: Krampus Cane (Legendary)
Krampus Cane (Legendary).description:
Stench of Death. Once per short or long rest, while holding this magic weapon, you can use a bonus action to speak its command word, causing it to emit the foul stench of death and decay for 10 minutes. The smell is noticeable by any creature within 60 feet of you that can smell. While Stench of Death is active, attacks made with this weapon deal an extra [[/r 4d6[necrotic]]]{4d6 necrotic damage}. In addition, while Stench of Death is active, any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of you must succeed on a [[/save constitution 17]]saving throw or be &Reference[poisoned] until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to Stench of Death for 24 hours.

Once per short or long rest, while holding this weapon, you can use an action to speak the command word to activate one of the following properties, each of which has a duration of 2 hours.

  • Goatshape. You transform yourself into a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmGoat0000000000]{goat} or a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmGiantGoat00000]{giant goat}, as per the polymorph spell.

  • Form of Krampus. Your body takes on several of Krampus' physical traits and special attacks.

    • Cloven Hooves. Your feet transform into cloven hooves. You have advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock you &Reference[prone], and your movement is unaffected by difficult terrain.

    • Horns. Long, pointed horns erupt from your skull. For the duration, you gain the following magical attack and ability.

      • Ram. Melee Weapon Attack (Horns): Proficiency Bonus plus STR Modifier to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 3d6 + STR Modifier piercing damage.

      • Charge. If you move at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hit it with a Ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra [[/r 3d6[piercing]]]{3d6 piercing damage}.

Bow of Empee (Very Rare).name: Bow of Empee (Very Rare)
Bow of Empee (Very Rare).description:
Progression: The Bow of Empee progresses whenever the attuned creature's proficiency bonus increases.

HUD. While holding this magic weapon, you can use a bonus action to activate or deactivate a heads-up display that appears in front of you. The display contains all options listed below, though those that require a rarity level above the weapon's current rarity are grayed out and unavailable. The display is visible to all creatures and disappears if you let go of the weapon. A crosshairs icon is highlighted on the HUD when you make a damage roll with this weapon.

Auto Reload. The weapon cannot use normal ammunition. Instead, it produces its own, creating one piece of magical ammunition when you make a ranged attack with it. The ammunition created by the weapon vanishes the instant after it hits or misses a target.

Psychological Warfare. Once per long rest, you can cause the weapon to produce menacing, glowing-red spikes for 1 minute. For the duration, you have advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks.

Arcane Ammo. The weapon has 6 charges, and it regains 1d4 + 2 expended charges when you finish a long rest. Prior to making your attack, you can expend a number of charges to empower the created ammunition with one of the following spell effects:

3 charges: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFireball00]{fireball},@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLightningB]{ lightning bolt}

2 charges: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMelfsAcidA]{acid arrow}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplScorchingR]{scorching ray}

1 charge: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGuidingBol]{guiding bolt}

0 charges: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFireBolt00]{fire bolt}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplRayofFrost]{ray of frost}

Empowered ammunition does not deal its normal piercing damage. A missed attack results in expended charges and no spell effect. Spells effects that target a point must instead target a creature or object. The spell save DC for spells which require targets to make a saving throw is 15.

Wilderland (Very Rare).name: Wilderland (Very Rare)
Wilderland (Very Rare).description:
Progression: Wilderland progresses whenever the attuned creature's proficiency bonus increases.

Sure-Footed. While holding this magic weapon, you gain a +[[@prof]] bonus to saving throws made against effects that would knock you &Reference[prone].

Charge. If you move at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hit it with an attack using this weapon on the same turn, the target takes an additional [[/r 2d6[piercing]]]{2d6 piercing damage}. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a [[/save strength 16]]saving throw or be knocked &Reference[prone].

Beast Sense. Twice per long rest, when you roll initiative, you can choose to roll with advantage.

Fight or Flight. Once per long rest, while you have fewer than half your hit points remaining, you can choose Fight or Flight.

  • Fight. You gain temporary hit points equal to four times your proficiency bonus and have advantage on all ability checks, saving throws, and attack rolls you make before the start of your next turn.

  • Flight. Until the end of your next turn, your speed is doubled, your AC increases by 2, and you have advantage on Dexterity saving throws.

Scalehead (Uncommon).name: Scalehead (Uncommon)
Scalehead (Uncommon).description:
Progression: Scalehead progresses whenever the attuned creature's Charisma modifier increases.

Dragonspeak. Once per long rest, while holding this magic weapon, you can use an action to speak the command word to grant you the ability to read, speak, and write Draconic for 12 hours.

Dragonhead. When you finish a long rest, you can choose from the below metals, each associated with a particular metallic dragon. When you do, the weapon's head takes the shape and color of that dragon's head, granting it extra damage on a hit until you finish your next long rest.

Brass. The weapon deals an extra [[/r 1d6[bludgeoning]]]{1d6 bludgeoning damage}.

Bronze. The weapon deals an extra [[/r 1d6[lightning]]]{1d6 lightning damage}.

Copper. The weapon deals an extra [[/r 1d6[acid]]]{1d6 acid damage}.

Gold. The weapon deals an extra [[/r 1d6[fire]]]{1d6 fire damage}.

Silver. The weapon deals an extra [[/r 1d6[cold]]]{1d6 cold damage}.

Onomatopoeia (Very Rare).name: Onomatopoeia (Very Rare)
Onomatopoeia (Very Rare).description:
Progression: Onomatopoeia progresses whenever the attuned creature's proficiency bonus increases.

These knuckle dusters are worn over your fists. When you make an attack with an unarmed strike, you gain a +2 bonus to attack and a +2 bonus to damage. When you hit a target with an unarmed strike, the creature takes an additional [[/r (1)[bludgeoning]]]{1 bludgeoning damage}.

Ka-Pow! At will, when you hit a target with an unarmed strike, you can speak the command word "Ka-Pow!" to deal an extra [[/r 1d4[bludgeoning]]]{1d4 bludgeoning damage}.

Bam! When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can expend 1 charge while speaking the command word "Bam!" to deal an extra [[/r 1d8[thunder]]]{1d8 thunder damage}. In addition, the creature must succeed on a [[/save strength 17]]saving throw or be pushed 5 feet away from you.

Insulting Injury. When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike and speak one of this item's command words, you can expend 1 charge to give the target disadvantage on its next ability check, attack roll, or saving throw.

Wham! When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can expend 2 charges while speaking the command word "Wham!" to deal an extra [[/r 1d10[bludgeoning]]]{1d10 bludgeoning damage}. After the attack, the word "Wham!" is embossed on the creature's armor, clothing, or skin where your hit landed, which remains until the creature finishes a short or long rest. While the word remains, the creature has disadvantage on Charisma checks and saving throws.

Eclipse's Edge (Uncommon).name: Eclipse's Edge (Uncommon)
Eclipse's Edge (Uncommon).description:
Progression: Eclipse's Edge progresses as its wielder performs acts that maintain or restore balance between opposing forces. Significant achievements are determined by the GM, but may include reconciling feuding factions or vanquishing a creature threatening to disrupt the world's natural order.

While holding this magic weapon, you can use an action to instantaneously light or snuff a candle, torch, or small campfire within 30 feet. In addition, you can use an action to cast the light cantrip, targeting this weapon.

When you hit a creature with a [[@prof/2]] CR with an attack using this weapon, the weapon gains 1 charge and begins to glow.

Lunar Strike. You can use an action to expend 2 charges to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMoonbeam00]{moonbeam }(save DC 13). Once you have cast moonbeam from this weapon, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

Alder's Travelling Garden (Common).name: Alder's Travelling Garden (Common)
Alder's Travelling Garden (Common).description:
Progression: Alder's Travelling Garden progresses whenever the attuned creature's Wisdom modifier increases.

Fertile Soil. Any seeds of a nonmagical plant that are placed on this magic weapon and remain there from sundown to sunrise take root on it and sprout in [[/r 1d6 #days]]{1d6 days}. Plants on the weapon require no light or nourishment to thrive. A maximum of six plants can live on the weapon. You can choose to remove any of the plants that have taken root.

Pilum of the Lost Legion (Rare).name: Pilum of the Lost Legion (Rare)
Pilum of the Lost Legion (Rare).description:
Progression: Pilum of the Lost Legion progresses each time its wielder uses it to kill a creature with a CR that is 3 or more higher than their level. The wielder must use the spear to deal at least one third of the damage required to kill the creature. Once the spear has progressed, it cannot do so again until the wielder's level increases.

Living Banner. While holding this magic weapon, and while no friendly creature is within 10 feet of you, you have have immunity from being pushed or knocked &Reference[prone].

Stand Like a Bastion. Once per long rest, if you are within 5 feet of an enemy, and no friendly creature is within 10 feet of you, you can use a bonus action to enter a defensive stance. While in this stance, you have advantage on attack rolls against creatures within 5 feet of you and you add your proficiency bonus to your AC and the damage you deal with this weapon. You can remain in the stance for 1 minute, or until you are &Reference[incapacitated].
